flixel.addons.plugin.FlxMouseControl

type
class
extends
flixel.plugin.FlxPlugin
FlxMouseControl

Static Variables

ASCENDING(inline,null) : Int

Use with sort() to sort in ascending order.

DESCENDING(inline,null) : Int

Use with sort() to sort in descending order.

clickTarget : flixel.addons.display.FlxExtendedSprite

dragTarget : flixel.addons.display.FlxExtendedSprite

The FlxExtendedSprite that is currently being dragged, if any.

isDragging : Bool

Is the mouse currently dragging a sprite? If you have just clicked but NOT yet moved the mouse then this might return false.

linkToDeadZone : Bool

Instead of using a mouseZone (which is calculated in world coordinates) you can limit the mouse to the FlxG.camera.deadzone area instead. If set to true the mouse will use the camera deadzone. If false (or the deadzone is null) no check will take place. Note that this takes priority over the mouseZone above. If the mouseZone and deadzone are set, the deadzone is used.

mouseZone : flixel.util.FlxRect

The mouse can be set to only be active within a specific FlxRect region of the game world. If outside this FlxRect no clicks, drags or throws will be processed. If the mouse leaves this region while still dragging then the sprite is automatically dropped and its release handler is called. Set the FlxRect to null to disable the zone.

sortIndex : String

The value that the FlxExtendedSprites are sorted by before deciding which is "on-top" for click select

sortOrder : Int

The sorting order. If the sortIndex is "y" and the order is ASCENDING then a sprite with a Y value of 200 would be "on-top" of one with a Y value of 100.

speedX : Int

The speed the mouse is moving on the X axis in pixels per frame

speedY : Int

The speed the mouse is moving on the Y axis in pixels per frame

Static Methods

addToStack(Item : flixel.addons.display.FlxExtendedSprite) : Void

parameters
Item The FlxExtendedSprite that was clicked by the mouse
Adds the given FlxExtendedSprite to the stack of potential sprites that were clicked, the stack is then sorted and the final sprite is selected from that

clear() : Void

Removes all references to any click / drag targets and resets this class

ID : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
IDs seem like they could be pretty useful, huh? They're not actually used for anything yet though.

active(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

alive(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Useful state for many game objects - "dead" (!alive) vs alive. kill() and revive() both flip this switch (along with exists, but you can override that).

cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
An array of camera objects that this object will use during draw(). This value will initialize itself during the first draw to automatically point at the main camera list out in FlxG unless you already set it. You can also change it afterward too, very flexible!

collisionType : flixel.system.FlxCollisionType

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

exists(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
This flag indicates whether this objects has been destroyed or not. Cannot be set, use destroy() and revive().

ignoreDrawDebug : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Setting this to true will prevent the object from appearing when the visual debug mode in the debugger overlay is toggled on.

visible(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether draw() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

destroy() : Void

overrides flixel.FlxBasic
Runs when this plugin is destroyed

draw() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Override this function to control how the object is drawn. Overriding draw() is rarely necessary, but can be very useful.

drawDebug() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

drawDebugOnCamera(?Camera : FlxCamera) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
parameters
Camera Which camera to draw the debug visuals to.
Override this function to draw custom "debug mode" graphics to the specified camera while the debugger's visual mode is toggled on.

kill() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for "killing" game objects. Use reset() to revive them. Default behavior is to flag them as nonexistent AND dead. However, if you want the "corpse" to remain in the game, like to animate an effect or whatever, you should override this, setting only alive to false, and leaving exists true.

onResize(Width : Int, Height : Int) : Void

inherited from flixel.plugin.FlxPlugin
parameters
Width The new window width
Height The new window Height
This function is called whenever the window size has been changed.

onStateSwitch() : Void

inherited from flixel.plugin.FlxPlugin
This function is called whenever the state is switched or reset (FlxG.switchState() and FlxG.resetState()).

revive() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true. In practice, this function is most often called by FlxObject.reset().

toString() : String

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Convert object to readable string name. Useful for debugging, save games, etc.

update() : Void

overrides flixel.FlxBasic
Main Update Loop - checks mouse status and updates FlxExtendedSprites accordingly
